questions.instructions:
Now practice using this Section 1 listening. Type your answers in the spaces provided.

Section 1 Questions 1-10

Complete the form below.

Write NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER for each answer.
questions.question:
Customer Requirements
Example: Product/Make required: Answer: Laptop computer / no preference
Requirements:
Large memory capacity: Not required
Main use: Completing [field 1] work while travelling
Requires model with: A suitable [field 2] for extended use away from electric points
Model recommended: Axer Business Pro (can be used for around [field 3] hours without recharge)
Price (Axer Business Pro): $ [field 4].95
Period of guarantee cover taken: Cover for [field 5]
Details on Computer
Customer Name: H. [field 6]
Title: Mrs
Address: [field 7] White Hill Rd [field 8] [field 9] Auckland
Post code: 0614
Mobile number: n/a will be [field 10]
Home number: (09) 821 7745
questions.no_answer_feedback: Make sure to listen carefully to the audio and take notes while listening. Check the transcript using the 'Show in transcript' button to find the answers.
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent work! You captured all the key details from the conversation.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite right. Listen to the audio again and use the 'Show in transcript' button to locate the specific information needed.

1.correct: Correct! The customer mentions using the laptop for word-processing work.
1.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen for what type of work the customer will be doing while travelling.
1.no_answer: The correct answer is 'word-processing'. The customer states she'll be using the laptop for word-processing work as she travels.

2.correct: Correct! The customer needs a model with a long battery life.
2.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen for what feature the customer needs for extended use away from electric points.
2.no_answer: The correct answer is 'battery' or 'long battery life'. The customer mentions needing a laptop with a long battery life for train journeys.

3.correct: Correct! The Axer Business Pro can be used for around 6 hours without recharge.
3.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen for how many hours the Axer Business Pro can be used without recharging.
3.no_answer: The correct answer is '6' (or 'six'). The shop assistant states the Business Pro can be used for around 6 hours before needing to recharge.

4.correct: Correct! The Axer Business Pro costs $1236.95.
4.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen carefully for the price of the Axer Business Pro.
4.no_answer: The correct answer is '1236'. The shop assistant states the Business Pro is $1236.95 (you only need to write the number before the decimal point).

5.correct: Correct! The customer chose 3 years of guarantee cover.
5.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen for how long the customer decided to extend the warranty.
5.no_answer: The correct answer is '3 years'. The customer agrees to extend the warranty to 3 years' cover.

6.correct: Correct! The customer's surname is Bartford.
6.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen carefully when the customer spells out her last name.
6.no_answer: The correct answer is 'Bartford'. The customer spells it: B-A-R-T-F-O-R-D.

7.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen for the house/street number in the address.
7.no_answer: The correct answer is '76'. The customer states her address is 76 White Hill Rd.

8.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen for what area White Hill Road is in.
8.no_answer: The correct answer is 'Maslee'. When asked what area the road is in, the customer replies 'Maslee' (spelled M-A-S-L-E-E).

9.correct: Correct! The location is West Auckland.
9.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen for which part of Auckland the address is in.
9.no_answer: The correct answer is 'West' or 'West Auckland'. The customer confirms it's in West Auckland.

10.correct: Correct! The mobile number will be changed.
10.incorrect: Incorrect. Listen for what will happen to the mobile number.
10.no_answer: The correct answer is 'changed'. The customer states her mobile number will be changed soon when she goes away.

audio.transcript:
Transcript:
Shop assistant Good morning, can I help you with anything or are you just looking at the moment?
Customer No, I would like some help please, I am thinking of buying a laptop computer and I'd like some advice if you are free.
Shop assistant Sure, I'd be glad to help. Have you got any particular make in mind?
Customer I'd be quite interested in looking at the Axer laptops; I have a PC at home of that make and it's pretty good. Though I don't have any preference really, I'll have a look at anything you recommend.
Shop assistant Well, we have quite a wide selection here. Are you looking for one with a large memory capacity?
Customer Not really, I do most of my work on my personal computer at home – I'm a writer you see – but..erm.. I am going to Europe next month for a three month trip, so I need a laptop to take with me. I'll just be using it for word-processing so I can work as I travel.
Shop assistant Okay well, the Axer Travel Companion Z40 might be a good model to look at. Here it is. It has a good memory size and it is a good price, but it's not really suitable for people who need to use a lot of accessories as it doesn't have many USB points.
Customer Right, but I don't really need that so I guess it could still be suitable for me. Oh, I forgot to mention, I am planning to take some long train journeys during my time in Europe, so I need a laptop with a long battery life.
Shop assistant Okay, well maybe we should look at some other models then. The Axer Travel Companion has quite a short battery life; you generally need to recharge it after 2 or 3 hours of use. Would that not really be long enough?
Customer I'm not really sure, but maybe just in case, I should buy one that needs charging less frequently.
Shop assistant Well, there's the Axer Business Pro, it's designed, as the name suggests, for business use. It has lots of additional functions that you may not really use, but you can use it for around 6 hours before needing to recharge the battery.
Customer And its quite a bit smaller too isn't it? Easier to carry. Is there much difference in price?
Shop assistant Yes, but it's probably worth paying the extra so you know that you can do what you want to do while you are away. The Travel Companion is $924.99 and the Business Pro is $1236.95
Customer Hmm, okay, but as you say, probably worth it. Okay, I'll take the Business Pro… erm, I'd like to pay some of the amount in cash and the rest by credit card, if that's okay. I've got $900 dollars in cash with me now.
Shop assistant That's no problem, so you want to pay $900 in cash and the remaining $336.95 on your card is that right?
Customer Yes, please
Shop assistant Okay well come over to the counter with me and I can get everything arranged for you.
Shop assistant Okay, well the laptop comes with a 12 month guarantee; however, if you would like to extend the warranty period for an additional 2 years, giving you 3 year's cover, you can do so by paying an extra $140. Would you be interested in that option?
Customer Well, it's already quite expensive, but I suppose I should pay the extra, after all I will be taking it on quite a long journey! I'll take pretty good care of it, I think but it's always better to be safe. So I'll take the 3 years' cover please.
Shop assistant Okay well, I need to put some of your details into our computer, just in case anything does go wrong and you need to make a claim. Could I have your full name please?
Customer Yes, it's Heather Bartford. That's B-A-R-T-F-O-R-D
Shop assistant And is that Mrs..Miss or Ms?
Customer It's Mrs
Shop assistant Right, and could you give me your address please?
Customer Yes, its 76 White Hill Rd
Shop assistant Is that white like the colour?
Customer Yes, it is.
Shop assistant And what area is the road in?
Customer It's Maslee
Shop assistant Is that M-A-S-L-E-A?
Customer Almost, the last letter is E (so its double ee at the end) not 'a'.
Shop assistant And is that in Auckland?
Customer Yes, it is, West Auckland
Shop assistant Do you know your postcode?
Customer It's 0614
Shop assistant Great, and your phone number please?
Customer My mobile is 027 643 718 but that will be changed soon, when I go away, so its better to keep my home number on record so that's (09) 821 7745.
Shop assistant Ok, so we have all your details for the warranty, so we can now sort out the payment. I'll just do that now and then I'll get your laptop from the store room.
Customer That's great, thanks very much.
